alert.note: Alert for Onondaga; Seneca; Southern Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 4:06PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Seneca, northern Cayuga and western Onondaga Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 406 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Phelps, or near Waterloo, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Van Buren, Baldwinsville, Seneca Falls, Waterloo, Owasco, Sennett, Fleming, Skaneateles and Marcellus. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 near 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
